alert.note: Alert for Cheatham; Dickson; Montgomery (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 02 at 5:59PM CDT until July 02 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 PM CDT FOR NORTHERN DICKSON...SOUTHEASTERN MONTGOMERY AND NORTHERN CHEATHAM COUNTIES... At 559 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 11 miles northwest of White Bluff, or 11 miles north of Dickson, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Ashland City, Charlotte, Vanleer, Slayden and Cheatham Dam. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.
